name: Katabatia
overview: Katabatia is a classic style roguelike for Commodore 64. Decend 20 floors to recover the Amulet of Yendor and return with it. Features Three classes, with four gods to worship. Sacrifice gold to improve a deity-specific stat. Three endings. Full joystick control, using menus for inventory interaction, etc. Spells, Potions, and special weapons and armor. Pour potions over equipment to change their magical abilities. Switch between animated, graphical tiles, or static text-mode graphics. SID soundtrack or sound effects. Originally designed for a single-button joystick, control is limited to 4 directions. With only one button to work with, you must hold the button to enter the menu. A button tap causes a turn to pass. Version 1.1 added keyboard commands. The game does not delete saves on death, but it does count how many times a game has been loaded, so it will know when someone has beaten the game in one sitting.
